bibl.title: Despatch from Albert Bushnell to William M. Evarts,. February 4, 1878
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
<div1 xml:lang="en" type="document"
<pb facs="20170615_143425" Hon. William M. Evarts Secretary of State Washington D.C.
Sir,
I am happy to inform the Department, that I am encouraged to expect an increase of American commerce at this port. Circular has just been received stating that the long established house of Mepers Mansfield + Roberts, the state street Boston, purpose to open + extend a permeant business in the coast + that me of then large Barks maybe expected at Gaboon about the 1st of March, write a General cargo". The French Commandant; has just informed me of the porbibility, that the Government will soon build a large En-tre-po at Gaboon, for the convenience of commerce; which shall vastly increase the business at this port + make it a great commercial center, for West Equatorial Africa. During my anticipated visit to the United States, I hope to interest our Merchants in Africas commerce; which visitation civilization is rapidly developing as well as philanthropies in the great work of Africa exploration *unclear *unclear last line* <pb facs="20170615_143506"
publish at the Bible Mourir in New York; while recruiting my much unfabbled strength
Sir, Most Respectfully, Your obedient Servant; Sthert Bushwell U.S. Coml Agent
